borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by S.51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act  2004)

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: FP/185-RE SHEET1 25-6-2014; FP/185-RE SHEET2 30-3-15; FP/185-RE SHEET3 6-10-14; FP/185-RE SHEET4 20-3-2014; FP/185-RE SHEET5 26-6-2014; Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The accessible parking bays indicated on drawing No. FP/185-RE SHEET2 30-3-15; shall be clearly marked with a British Standard disabled symbol and permanently retained for the use of disabled persons and their vehicles and for no other purpose. The accessible bay must have 1.2 metre wide side and rear hatched transfer zones.Reason:  To ensure and promote easier access for disabled persons to the development in accordance with policy BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The extension hereby permitted shall not be used other than between the hours of 7am and 10pm.Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework Borough Wide Development Policies

No parts of the external curtilage of the site shall be used for religious gatherings, praying, festivals or other meetings of any kind.Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

No external amplification or loud speaker system shall be placed on or used beyond any walls, or roof structures of the building.Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties and in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The windows in the south east elevation of the extension shall be fixed shut and not be capable of opening. Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

Noise from activities taking place at the mosque shall be controlled so as to be inaudible inside adjoining and other noise-sensitive premises in the vicinity of the mosque. The initial test for compliance with the 'inaudibility' criterion will be that noise should be no more than barely audible outside those noise sensitive premises. In the event there is disagreement as to whether noise emitted from the mosque is or is not audible the following numerical limits shall be used to determine compliance with this condition:  the LAeq (MN) shall not exceed LA90 (WMN) and;the L10 (MN) shall not exceed L90 (WMN) in any 1/3 octave band between 40Hz and 160Hz.MN = Mosque noise level, WMN = Representative background noise level without the mosque noise, both measured 1m from the fa√ßade of the noise-sensitive premises over a period of 15 (fifteen) minutesReason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties and in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The existing masonry wall on the south east boundary shall be permanently retained at a height of no less than 2m for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue loss of residential amenity to the rear neighbouring properties and in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.
description: Erection of single storey rear extension to mosque.
